ATM Cash Withdrawal Charges:The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has hiked ATM cash withdrawal charges effective May 1, 2025. Yes Bank's ATM charges will be ₹23 per financial transaction and ₹10 per non-financial transaction after the first 5 free monthly transactions.

Fundraising and Shareholding:While not specifically on May 1st, news in early May revealed that Yes Bank had approved a plan to raise up to ₹16,000 crore via a mix of equity and debt, potentially involving dilution of shares by SBI and other lenders in favor of Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation (SMBC). SMBC was reportedly looking to acquire a 20% stake in Yes Bank.

Stock Performance:Yes Bank's stock exhibited some fluctuations around May 1st. On May 2nd, the stock saw a slight increase of 0.06% before stagnating at ₹17.70 later the same day. On May 5th, the stock saw a jump of 0.17%.

Regulatory Filings:Regulatory filings related to debt securities and ISINs for the half-year ending March 31, 2025, were submitted in early April 2025.

Analyst Outlook:Analyst predictions around this time indicated a potential downside for Yes Bank's stock price, citing low Return on Equity (ROE) and governance risks, despite some hope from potential investment and profit growth.

Regulatory Penalty:It's important to note that a few weeks later, on May 16th, the RBI imposed a penalty of ₹29.6 lakh on Yes Bank for non-compliance with directions on financial statements and disclosure of customer complaints.
